trans-unit.source: Represents a control that enables a user to select a date by using a visual calendar display.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> control can be used on its own, or as a drop-down part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> supports only the Gregorian calendar.
The following table provides information about tasks that are typically associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar>.
Have the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> display a month, an entire year, or a decade.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayMode%2A> property to Month, Year, or Decade.
Specify whether the user can select a date, a range of dates, or multiple ranges of dates.
Specify dates that cannot be selected.
Specify the range of dates that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> displays.
Specify whether the current date is highlighted.
Use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewbox> or set the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.LayoutTransform%2A> property to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.ScaleTransform>.

Note that if you set the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Width%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Height%2A> properties of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar>, the actual calendar does not change its size.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> control provides basic navigation using either the mouse or keyboard.
The following table summarizes keyboard navigation.

Changes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> property if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectionMode%2A> property is not set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode.None>.
Changes the month of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> property.
Note that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> does not change.
Note that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> does not change.

If <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectionMode%2A> is not set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode.SingleDate> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode.None>, extends the range of selected dates.
Changes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> to the first day of the current month.
Changes the month of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> to the first month of the year.
Changes the year of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> to the first year of the decade.
Changes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> to the last day of the current month.
Changes the month of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> to the last month of the year.
Changes the year of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> to the last year of the decade.

Switches <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayMode%2A> to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarMode.Month> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarMode.Year> represented by focused item.
To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar>, see [Calendar Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/calendar-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar"></xref> class.
Gets a collection of dates that are marked as not selectable.
Dates in this collection will appear gray and crossed out on the calendar.
To make all past dates not selectable, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarBlackoutDatesCollection.AddDatesInPast%2A> method provided by the collection returned by this property.
One or more object elements of type <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarDateRange>.
A collection of dates that cannot be selected.
The default value is an empty collection.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> associated with the control's internal <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.CalendarButton"></xref> object.
The key that identifies the resource being requested.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
The current style of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.CalendarButton"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> associated with the control's internal <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.CalendarDayButton"></xref> object.
The key that identifies the resource being requested.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
The current style of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.CalendarDayButton"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> associated with the control's internal <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.CalendarItem"></xref> object.
The key that identifies the resource being requested.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
The current style of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.CalendarItem"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the date to display.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayMode%2A> properties specify what the calendar displays and what has focus within the calendar.

The user can change the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> only when <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayMode%2A> is set to Month, but the user might change the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> when the Calendar is in Year and Decade mode.
The following table describes how the mode changes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> changes when the user navigates to a different month.
The month of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> changes when the user clicks or navigates to a different month.
The year of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> changes when the user clicks or navigates to another year.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> is ignored if its value is outside of the range of dates that is specified by <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateEnd%2A> properties.
A date that is in one of the formats that are listed in the [DateTime XAML Syntax](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/datetime-xaml-syntax.md) topic.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate"></xref> property is changed.
This event occurs after <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A> is assigned its new value.
Gets or sets the last date in the date range that is available in the calendar.

You can restrict the range of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateEnd%2A> properties.
A user cannot scroll to or select dates outside of this range.

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> property to a date that is after <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateEnd%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateEnd%2A> is set to the same value as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A>.
A date that is in one of the formats that are listed in the [DateTime XAML Syntax](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/datetime-xaml-syntax.md) topic.
The last date that is available in the calendar.
Gets or sets the first date that is available in the calendar.
You can restrict the range of a Calendar by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateEnd%2A> properties.
A user cannot scroll to or select dates outside of this range.

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> property to a date that is before <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateStart%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateStart%2A> is set to the same value as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A>.
A date that is in one of the formats that are listed in the [DateTime XAML Syntax](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/datetime-xaml-syntax.md) topic.
The first date that is available in the calendar.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the calendar displays a month, year, or decade.
A Calendar can display a month, a year, or a decade.
The following table lists how the user navigates to each mode.
To navigate to Year mode, click the month heading.
To navigate to Decade mode, click the year heading.
To navigate to Month mode, click one of the displayed months.
To navigate to Year mode, click one of the displayed years.
A value that indicates what length of time the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar"></xref> should display.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayMode"></xref> property is changed.
Gets or sets the day that is considered the beginning of the week.
A <xref href="System.DayOfWeek"></xref> that represents the beginning of the week.
The default is the <xref href="System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.FirstDayOfWeek"></xref> that is determined by the current culture.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the current date is highlighted.
`true` if the current date is highlighted; otherwise, `false`.
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar"></xref> control when a new template is applied.
This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as rebuilding layout pass, calls the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> method.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer"></xref> for use by the [!INCLUDE[silverlight](~/includes/silverlight-md.md)] automation infrastructure.

This method creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> instance if one has not been created for the control instance; otherwise, it returns the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.CalendarAutomationPeer> previously created.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> routed event that occurs when the user presses a key while this control has focus.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> overrides the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.OnKeyDown%2A> method to support keyboard navigation.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> class.

This implementation marks the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown> event as handled by setting the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property of the event data to `true` when a keystroke, such as pressing an ARROW key, performs a navigation action.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyUp"></xref> routed event that occurs when the user releases a key while this control has focus.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> overrides the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.OnKeyDown%2A> method to support keyboard navigation.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> class.
This implementation does not change the handled state (the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property) of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.KeyUp> event data.
The control raises the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDatesChanged> event by calling <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEvent%2A>.
Gets or sets the currently selected date.
Use this property when <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectionMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode.SingleDate>.
In other modes, this property will always be the first date in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A>.
A date that is in one of the formats that are listed in the [DateTime XAML Syntax](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/datetime-xaml-syntax.md) topic.
The specified date is outside the range specified by <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateStart"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateEnd"></xref>
The specified date is in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.BlackoutDates"></xref> collection.
If set to anything other than `null` when <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectionMode"></xref> is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode.None"></xref>.
Gets a collection of selected dates.
Dates can be added to the collection either individually or in a range using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.SelectedDatesCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
Depending on the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectionMode%2A> property, adding a date or range to the collection may cause it to be cleared.
The following table lists how <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode> affects the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A> property.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> cannot be set and no values can be added to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A>.
Only a single date can be selected, either by setting <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> or the first value in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A>.
A single range of dates can be selected.

Setting <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A>, adding a date individually to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A>, or using <xref:System.Windows.Controls.SelectedDatesCollection.AddRange%2A> will clear all previous values from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A>.
Multiple non-contiguous ranges of dates can be selected.

Adding a date individually to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A> or using <xref:System.Windows.Controls.SelectedDatesCollection.AddRange%2A> will not clear <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A>.
Setting <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> will still clear <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates%2A>, but additional dates or ranges can then be added.
Adding a range that includes some dates that are already selected or overlaps with another range results in the union of the ranges and does not cause an exception.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.SelectedDatesCollection"></xref> object that contains the currently selected dates.
The default is an empty collection.
Occurs when the collection returned by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates"></xref> property is changed.
Gets or sets a value that indicates what kind of selections are allowed.
This property determines whether the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> allows no selection, selection of a single date, or selection of multiple dates.
The selection mode is specified with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode> enumeration.
When this property is changed, all selected dates will be cleared.
A value that indicates the current selection mode.
Provides a text representation of the selected date.
A text representation of the selected date, or an empty string if <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate"></xref> is `null`.
